patient_information: Age: 32 years Sex: female Country of origin: Malawi Comorbidities: none reported Immunosuppression: none reported Vaccinations: unknown Allergies: unknown
chief_complaint: Symptoms: headache and blurred vision for 3 weeks Duration: gradual onset, does not respond to over-the-counter painkillers
history_of_present_illness: Timeline: 3-week history of symptoms Key symptoms: chronic headache, blurred vision Severity pattern: gradual onset Other symptoms: no fever, no history of convulsions or head trauma
exposure_and_epidemiology: Residence travel: recent travel to Malawi Vectors animals: unknown Water food risks: unknown Contacts season outbreak: unknown Occupation: unknown
vitals: Temperature: normal Blood pressure: normal Heart rate: normal Respiratory rate: normal Oxygen saturation: normal
physical_exam: {'general_appearance': 'wasted and slightly anaemic', 'vital_signs': 'normal', 'head_and_neck': 'no neck stiffness, normal visual acuity on both sides', 'abdomen': 'normal', 'neurological': "left lateral gaze abduction deficit of the left eye with 'blurring of vision' reported by patient"}
labs_and_diagnostics: Full blood count: normocytic anaemia and thrombocytopenia Malaria rapid test: negative Cryptococcal antigen: positive Lumbar puncture: CSF clear, opening pressure increased at 50 cmH2O
differential_diagnosis: Chronic meningitis: most likely diagnosis Cryptococcal meningitis: likely differential diagnosis Tuberculous meningitis: less likely differential diagnosis Bacterial meningitis: less likely differential diagnosis
management_and_clinical_course: Initial treatment: presumptive antimalarial treatment (artemether/lumefantrine) and antibiotics (amoxicillin) Lumbar punctures: repeated therapeutic lumbar punctures Antifungal treatment: oral fluconazole 1200 mg Outcome: patient died 6 weeks later of an unknown cause
final_diagnosis: Disease name short: Cryptococcal meningitis Confirmation method: positive cryptococcal antigen test in CSF Evidence: chronic meningitis, positive cryptococcal antigen, normal CSF findings except for increased opening pressure
